@ilyasu Yeah, much longer discussion, but I think ETC vs ETH split is now established enough to show that a fork can be value creating.
This is a new paradigm for dispute resolution for digital property. Won‚Äôt work for physical goods. But if it works for money, may be enough.
With flight, you lose everything. With a fork, a community splits but retains their private keys and hence their property.
Until now, in disputes over scarce resources your options were limited to fight or flight. We now have a third primitive: fork.
It‚Äôs early and messy, but the market-based resolution of differences within the crypto community is actually a major innovation.
For perspective, the Netscape IPO that really kicked off the Internet era was 8,131 days ago. Going forward 8,131 days puts us into 2040.
By 2040, everyone under 30 will have never known a world without Bitcoin. It may as well be gold. That‚Äôs the long-t‚Ä¶ https://t.co/ORfTsfctuK

Twitter‚Äôs headlines are shown >100M+ times per day, every time a user performs a search. And shown to a highly influential global audience.
Facebook doesn‚Äôt do first party content, and NYT has no concept of user profile or social network. Moments is a unique combination.
Moments is shown on every search within the Twitter app. And knows exactly which users have seen and engaged with each story.
Twitter Moments has quietly become one of the most important news outlets in the world. Maybe the most important. It drives the narrative.
